articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Condolence Telegram to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Condolence Telegram to Syrian President
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Monday sent a message of condolences to Bashar Al-Assad, regional secretary of the Arab Baath Socialist Party and President of Syria.
					 The message said:
					
					Upon hearing sad news that your brother Mr. Majud Hafez Al-Assad died of an incurable disease, I offer my heartfelt condolences to you and his bereaved family.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Kenyan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Kenyan President
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Mwai Kibaki, President of Kenya, on Dec. 10 on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow strong as required by the new century, Kim in the message wished the President great success in his work for ensuring socio-political stability of the country and achieving its economic development.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets KICC Delegation
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets KICC Delegation
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with a delegation of the "Korea International Chamber of Commerce" (KICC) headed by its Honorary President Kerri M.L Zhou at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: US Businessmen Delegation Here
articles.content:
US Businessmen Delegation Here
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of U.S. businessmen headed by General Charles Boyd, president and CEO of the Business Executives for National Security (BENS), arrived here by air on Monday.

articles.title: Pyongyang Tongdaewon Secondary School
articles.content:
Pyongyang Tongdaewon Secondary School
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Tongdaewon Secondary School is well known in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea for women's football.
					 The school has won titles five times and gained good results over ten times in women's football matches of secondary schools at national schoolchildren's sports contests for Jongilbong prize.
					
					 In this period it has brought up a lot of promising reserve footballers.
					
					 Kim Hyang Mi and O Kum Ran, graduates of the school, played a great role in the DPRK's winning the 3rd FIFA U-20 Women's World Championships, the 14th Asian Women's Football Championships and the women's football event of the 14th Asian Games.
					
					 Kwon Pom Hyang, Pong Son Hwa and other graduates of the school are now active in the national junior women's football team, national juvenile women's football team and other local teams.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Settle Its Past as Early as Possible
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Its Past as Early as Possible
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- It is a historical responsibility and a legal and moral obligation for Japan to honestly admit the monstrous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean people in the past and make reparation for them, observes Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 However, the Japanese reactionaries are persistently distorting and justifying the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity, far from settling their past.
					
					 When the crimes related to "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army were brought to light, the Japanese reactionaries openly denied them, asserting that "such thing did not exist" and "it was a fabrication." But the discovery of a lot of data proving the state's involvement in those crimes made it impossible for the Japanese authorities to evade their state responsibility for the sexual slavery any longer. Nevertheless, they are not yet sincere in their approach towards the issue of reparation. 
					
					 Running the whole gamut of excuses to shun the settlement of its past, Japan is zealously inciting militarism throughout its society.
					
					 What is ridiculous is the fact that Japan, which committed such hideous crimes against humanity in the past, is getting frantic with an anti-DPRK human rights racket at the UN and other international arenas, far from reflecting on those crimes.
					
					 An assailant is obliged to honestly admit and reflect on his past crimes committed against his victim and settle them. This is a due obligation and ethical morality and international usage. 
					
					 Japan should face up to the reality and opt for settling its past as early as possible. It is the trend of the times that those countries which imposed disasters upon humankind during World War II break with their past histories and turn over a new leaf in the direction of peace. If Japan swims against this trend, it will not be able to escape international isolation and destruction, forsaken by the world.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Controlling Media
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Controlling Media
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are becoming more desperate in their moves to put media under their control. 
					 Some days ago, eight members of the management board of the south Korean MBC including its manager Om Ki Yong simultaneously tendered their resignations to the managing director of the "Council for Promotion of Broadcasting and Culture". 
					
					 This is a tragedy caused by a dastardly plot hatched by the puppet authorities to paralyze the function of MBC as a public institution representing public opinion and completely put it under their control. 
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the above-said council made up of neo-conservatives subservient to the authorities has desperately worked to put MBC under government control. 
					
					 It is as clear as noonday what type of man the south Korean conservative group will appoint as manager of MBC. 
					
					 The ruling quarters of south Korea should never forget the lesson taught by history in which the erstwhile military dictators were thrown into the abyss of ruin by the people for enforcing fascist dictatorship through their seizure and control over media.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Reunification Action under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-Reunification Action under Fire
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities took such anti-reunification action as disallowing eight persons of the delegates of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to participate in the meeting of All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration slated to open in Shenyang, China, on December 13. 
					 The south Korean Ministry of Unification took such action under the pretext of "considering the present situation of the inter-Korean relations, ensuring security and maintaining order" and the like. Among those who were "selectively barred from the participation in the meeting" were Ri Kang Sil, permanent steering member of the above-said south side committee, Han Chung Mok, organizational chairman of the committee, Jong Tae Yon, joint executive chairman of the committee, Choe Yong Ok, joint secretary general of the committee, Jon Song Do, secretary general of its Peasants Headquarters of the committee who doubles as member of the south Korean Federation of Peasants Associations, and others. All of them are members of the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea. 
					
					 The puppet authorities took this action in the wake of disallowing members of the above-said committee to participate in the meeting of the co-chairmen of the All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration held in Pyongyang in last March and attend the working-level contacts of the North Side and the South Side Committees for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held in July and September. The repeated actions taken by them are lashing people of different circles into fury.

articles.title: Dismantlement of Barrier of Division Urged
articles.content:
Dismantlement of Barrier of Division Urged
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Punjab Provincial Committee of the National Workers' Party, the Organization for Afro-Asian People's Solidarity, the Peasants Committee and the Trade Union Federation of Pakistan, the Lahor Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and the Pakistan Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification issued a joint statement on Dec. 8 in demand of the dismantlement of the concrete wall.
					 The south Korean authorities are persistently seeking the national division and confrontation while keeping 240 odd km-long concrete wall, built in the area south of the Military Demarcation Line in the Korean Peninsula under the patronage of the foreign forces, the statement pointed out, and said:
					
					 There are many large and small walls and military structures on the earth, but no such barrier can be found as the above-said concrete wall which was built so tremendously in the contiguous territory of one country that cannot stand comparison with state boundaries.
					
					 The concrete wall, a physical barrier cutting off the vein of the Korean nation and bisecting its territory, is a symbol of the national division and the north-south confrontation.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people who love peace and work hard to achieve the reunification of the country in the spirit of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the milestone of Korea's reunification.
					
					 We demand that all the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces withdraw from south Korea at once, the Korean Armistice Agreement be replaced with a peace agreement and the south Korean authorities pull down the concrete wall, a symbol of division, at an early date.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Lauded in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Lauded in Mexico
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released the 48th issue of its bulletin titled "Time-honored Hoeryong" on the occasion of the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine. Carried in the bulletin was a picture of the woman commander of Mt. Paektu.
					 The bulletin noted that Kim Jong Suk, who crossed over the River Tuman to an alien land with her family in her childhood, devoted her all to the liberation of Korea and the accomplishment of President Kim Il Sung's cause of building a country and passed away, failing to visit her birthplace she desired to do so ardently.
					
					The Korean people have kept her native home in Hoeryong in its original state and built her statue on Osan Hill, wishing that General Secretary Kim Jong Il would visit her birthplace, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 At last Kim Jong Il visited Hoeryong in February this year on his endless journey for field guidance.
					
					 Media of the world described his visit to Hoeryong as an action prompted by his assurance that he would bring the future of a thriving nation, contending that the purport of this visit was to announce that everything is ready to realize Kim Jong Suk's lifelong desire.
					
					 Her desire was to build Korea into a powerful country which is flourishing in all aspects and where the people lead a happy life with nothing to desire more in the world.
					
					 Her desire is being successfully carried into a reality with socialist Korea which is daily changing its looks to emerge a thriving nation by 2012.

articles.title: DPRK Significant Day Observed
articles.content:
DPRK Significant Day Observed
Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- Meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows were held in Mongolia and South Africa and a book, photo and handicraft exhibition opened in Peru with due ceremony on Dec. 7 to mark the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of
					 Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 Displayed in the venues of the functions were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal feats and the true picture of Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the Korean people's wisdom and talents. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the events and the Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" was appreciated.
					
					 E. Maksim, executive chairperson of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development, said it is of weighty significance that the Korean people held Kim Jong Il in high esteem as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army in 1991. He has trained the KPA to be an invincible army and led the work to make shining achievements in socialist construction over the past 18 years, the speaker added.
					
					 A teacher of the Literary College of Mongolia introduced the brilliant life of Kim Jong Suk, stressing that present Korea would have been unthinkable without her.
					
					 Bonakele Majuba, secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party, said that on the said significant occasions they warmly congratulate the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people working world-startling miracles and innovations in the drive to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 It is thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il that the fireworks for a thriving nation and fantastic evening of Pyongyang could be displayed in the DPRK, the secretary said, praising him as the peerlessly great man and the master of leadership art.
					
					 The governor of Changcay Municipality, Huaral District, Lima Province of Peru, said they hope that Korea would be reunified as early as possible and demonstrate its might as a thriving nation.
					
					  A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event held in South Africa.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung 
 Pyongyang, December 14 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung visited a mine in North Phyongan Province on a hot day of late July, Juche 38 (1949).
					 The open mine, panning out iron ore from river sands, found itself in a very critical condition with no proper tools, severely damaged by the Japanese imperialists when they were being defeated in the war.
					
					 It was at lunch time when the President reached a panning place. There were no people working there but only their poor tools. 
					
					 He, suggesting iron ore panning, walked on hot sands towards the riverside.
					
					 Despite the attendant officials' repeated requests for him not to do such a work in the sultry day, he took a spade to dig out sands and put them into a pan, saying that miners had always done it in such a condition.
					
					 He then shook the pan to wash for iron ore.
					
					After extracting a large amount of iron ore together with officials, he went out of the river wiping sweat off his forehead.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung gave the officials a precious instruction to the following effect before leaving the mine: Panning out iron ore in the river looks easy but the diggers must feel a severe backache from many hours of work. We should have this work done with the help of machines at an early date so as to make it easy and, at the same time, increase the iron ore production necessary for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Jefe de delegacion de APS de Corea aboga por paz y seguridad de Asia
articles.content:
Jefe de delegacion de APS de Corea aboga por paz y seguridad de Asia
  Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El jefe de la delegacion de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de  la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea pronuncio  un discurso en la sesion plenaria de la 4a asamblea general de la reunion parlamentaria de Asia efectuada el dia 8 en Indonesia.
					  El expreso agradecimiento a los pueblos de varios paises de Asia que envian el apoyo y la solidaridad con la lucha del pueblo coreano por la paz y la reunificacion de la Peninsula Coreana y la construccion de una gran potencia prospera y afirmo que en el futuro tambien la RPDC contribuira dinamicamente a la paz y la seguridad, el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad de Asia tomando la mano con los pueblos asiaticos.
					
					  Prosiguio que los pueblos asiaticos deben tener el orgullo y dignidad debidos de que han registrado la brillante historia forjando sus destinos con sus manos propias y superar con la fuerza de la unidad y solidaridad basadas en la independencia el desafio y dificultades con que se enfrenta el continente.
					
					   Pese a que muchos paises asiaticos tienen abundantes recursos humanos y materiales y la poderosa potencialidad de desarrollo, son maximas victimas de litigios  regionales y la crisis economica mundial causados por la arbitrariedad de la "unica superpotencia" y la irresponsabilidad de las potencias occidentales, indico y continuo:
					
					  En la Peninsula Coreana perdura hasta hoy a mas de  60 anos el sufrimiento de la division nacional impuesta por las fuerzas extranjeras, no se realiza todavia la aspiracion del pueblo palestino a fundar el Estado independiente y tambien el derecho del pueblo iranes a las actividades nucleares con fines pacifistas se ve despreciado por las potencias occidentales.
					
					  Los parlamentarios que abogan por la opinion publica de Asia deben unirse y cooperar entre si en la lucha por construir Asia independiente, pacifica y prospera creyendo las fuerzas de sus pueblos y apoyandose en estas.
					
					  Hoy en dia, el pueblo coreano se levanta como un solo hombre en la ofensiva general para abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera en 2012 en que se cumplira el centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					  La RPDC deja abierta de par en par la puerta de la amistad y cooperacion a todos los paises que tratan amistosamente nuestro pais bajo el ideal de la independencia, la paz y la amistad y concede siempre prioridad a la cooperacion con los paises asiaticos.
					
					  Ejecutara cabalmente la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio y la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre que acordaron los encuentros-cumbre del Norte y el Sur de Corea y gozan del apoyo y aplausos mundiales y lograra sin falta la causa historica de la reunificacion de la patria enarbolando la bandera de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".

articles.title: EE.UU. es responsable de la amenaza y proliferacion nucleares
articles.content:
EE.UU. es responsable de la amenaza y proliferacion nucleares
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Al referirse a que ultimamente, en los paises de Europa Occidental, donde estan emplazadas numerosas armas nucleares de Estados Unidos, se hacen mas fuertes que nunca las voces exigiendo la retirada de las mismas, el rotativo Minju Joson subraya que el desarme nuclear es una demanda de la epoca y una tendencia internacional.
					  Pero, EE.UU. recurrio a todos los medios para mantener a toda costa las armas nucleares ubicadas en dicha region geografica insistiendo en que la existencia de cerca de 200 bombas termonucleares B61 emplazadas en Italia, Belgica, Alemania y Holanda son importantes para la seguridad de la Organizacion del Tratado del Atlantico Norte y frenaran el desarrollo de armas nucleares por parte de sus paises miembros, revela Minju Joson en un comentario individual publicado el dia 13 y prosigue:
					
					  Ese hecho demuestra que el "desarme nuclear", de que habla tanto EE.UU. por apariencias, no pasa de ser un engano y que este es el responsable principal de la amenaza y proliferacion nucleares.
					
					  Este imperio trata de tomar la absoluta supremacia nuclear para mantener a raya a otras potencias, amenazar y doblegar a los paises independientes antiimperialistas y realizar su ambicion de dominar el mundo. He aqui su invariable politica y meta estrategica.
					
					  EE.UU. no deja de amenazar y chantajear a otros paises con muchas armas de exterminio masivo, incluyendo las nucleares, instaladas en todas partes del mundo.
					
					  Dado que con el fin de la guerra fria se desaparecio el pretexto de aumento de las fuerzas armadas nucleares, da acicate ahora a la modernizacion de las mismas malgastando fabulosos fondos con el nuevo subterfugio de hacer frente a la supuesta "amenaza nuclear" de alguien.
					
					  Debido a las freneticas maniobras de EE.UU. por el aumento de gastos militares y la guerra nuclear, se crean en el mundo la nueva carrera armamentista nuclear y el peligro de confrontacion nuclear y a la larga, se ven amenazadas de gravedad la paz y la seguridad del mundo.
					
					  Al dejar intactos esos artefactos norteamericanos, no se puede establecer la paz en el globo terraqueo.
					
					  Esto es la opinion unanime de los pueblos del mundo amantes de la paz, incluyendo los paises europeos, y la demanda de la epoca.
					
					  EE.UU. debe parar ahora mismo sus maniobras anacronicas y anti-pacificas para la guerra nuclear escuchando la demanda de la sociedad internacional sobre la reduccion y la cancelacion de armas nucleares.

articles.title: Japon debe liquidar su pasado criminal, senala Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japon debe liquidar su pasado criminal, senala  Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Reconocer con sinceridad e indemnizar los monstruosos actos criminales cometidos en el pasado por los imperialistas japoneses contra el pueblo coreano es la responsabilidad historica y la obligacion juridica y moral de Japon.
					Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 14 y continua:
					
					  Pero, los reaccionarios japoneses tergiversan y justifican persistentemente sus crimenes antieticos lejos de liquidarlos.
					
					  Cuando fue revelado el acto criminal del ejercito japones en cuanto a las "consoladoras", ellos lo negaron abiertamente diciendo que eso "no  existio", "no pasa de ser un fraude".
					
					  Al ser descubiertos numerosos datos que testimonian la participacion del Estado en ese crimen, las autoridades japonesas no pudieron evitar por mas tiempo tal responsabilidad estatal. Pero, no muestran todavia la actitud sincera en el problema de la indemnizacion.
					
					  Al contrario, Japon se afana en inculcar la idea  militarista a toda la sociedad en vez de la liquidacion del pasado criminal.
					
					  Lo peor es que ese pais isleno, que en el pasado cometio el archicrimen antietico, no reflexiona al respecto, sino se entrega mas a los alborotos de "DDHH" anti-RPDC en la ONU y otra escena internacional.
					
					  Reconocer, reflexionar y liquidar con sinceridad los crimenes del pasado es el deber natural, la etica y la moralidad del danador, asumidos ante el danado y es la costumbre internacional.
					
					  Japon debe ver correctamente la realidad y liquidar cuanto antes su pasado criminal.
					
					Hoy, los paises, que en el periodo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial impusieron calamidades a la humanidad, parten de nuevo hacia la paz rompiendo con la historia del pasado.
					
					Si Japon nada contra esta corriente de la epoca, sera abandonado en el mundo y no evitara el aislamiento internacional y la derrota.

articles.title: Demandan en Pakistan desmantelar muralla de hormigon armado
articles.content:
Demandan en Pakistan desmantelar muralla de hormigon armado
  Pyongyang, 14 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Comite del Partido Nacional de Trabajadores de Pakistan en la Provincia de Punjab, la Organizacion Pakistani para la Solidaridad con los Pueblos Afro-Asiaticos, el Comite Kissan, la Federacion Sindical de Pakistan, la Sucursal de Lahore de la Asociacion de Amistad Pakistan-Corea y el Comite Pakistani de Apoyo a la Reunificacion de Corea publicaron el dia 8 una declaracion conjunta demandando desmantelar la muralla de hormigon armado.
					  El documento revela que las autoridades surcoreanas persiguen de continuo la division y la confrontacion fratricidas manteniendo esa muralla de mas de 240 km de largo que construyeron en la parte Sur de la linea de demarcacion militar de la Peninsula Coreana con el amparo de las fuerzas extranjeras, y prosigue:
					
					  En la Tierra hay muchos muros grandes y pequenos y estructuras militares, pero no hay ninguno como esa muralla que se ha levantado incomparablemente tremenda que una linea fronteriza en el territorio de un pais unido por el mismo filon.
					
					  Esa muralla de hormigon armado es el simbolo de la division nacional y la confrontacion intercoreana, siendo la barrera fisica que corto el vaso sanguineo de la nacion y partio el territorio nacional.
					
					  Nos solidarizamos fuertemente con el pueblo coreano que ama la paz y lucha por reunificar el pais segun el espiritu de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio, jalon de la reunificacion de Corea.
					
					  Demandamos que todas las fuerzas agresoras del imperialismo norteamericano salgan ahora mismo del suelo surcoreano, el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea se sustituya por el pacto de paz y las autoridades surcoreanas destruyan cuanto antes esa muralla, simbolo de la division.
